title: Prosciutto & Peach Breakfast Tartine
description: Open-faced tartines topped with tangy ricotta, thinly sliced ripe peaches, and silky prosciutto, finished with a drizzle of honey and lemon zest for bright contrast. Quick to assemble and ideal for a leisurely breakfast or light brunch with a balance of sweet, salty, and creamy textures.

ingredients.notes: thinly sliced, about 2 slices per tartine

ingredients.display_name: rustic country bread (sourdough or ciabatta), sliced 1/2-inch
ingredients.notes: one slice per tartine; approximately 90 g per slice

ingredients.display_name: fresh lemon (zest and a little juice)
ingredients.notes: zest of half and 1 tsp juice

steps.text: Prep peaches: wash and thinly slice peaches into 1/4-inch wedges; set aside and keep at room temperature.
Prepare ricotta spread: in a small bowl combine ricotta, a pinch of sea salt, lemon zest from half a lemon, and about 1 tsp lemon juice; whisk to a spreadable consistency and set aside.
Toast bread: heat a large skillet over medium heat, brush both sides of bread slices lightly with 1 tbsp olive oil, and toast 1-2 minutes per side until golden and slightly crisp.
Assemble base: spread a generous layer of the ricotta mixture on each toasted slice of bread while still warm.
Layer toppings: arrange peach slices evenly over ricotta, then drape prosciutto slices on top, tearing them to fit if necessary.
Finish and serve: drizzle remaining olive oil and honey over each tartine, scatter torn basil leaves, grind fresh black pepper over top, and serve immediately.
